cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 75 mi S of Mobile Alabama
cyclone.trajectory: drifting north-northeast toward the Alabama–Mississippi Gulf Coast, then turning inland across the Southeast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the AL/MS state line (east of Bay St. Louis MS to Navarre FL hurricane-warning area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in Louisiana (hurricane watches confined east of MS/AL border)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Bay St. Louis MS westward to Grand Isle LA for tropical-storm conditions; Storm-Surge Warning from Mouth of the Mississippi River to Pearl River including Lake Borgne
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward through Alabama and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible, especially in exposed areas near the mouth of the Mississippi River.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft of inundation possible from the mouth of the Mississippi River eastward to the Pearl River, affecting Plaquemines Parish riverbanks and low-lying facilities.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could deliver 4–8 inches with localized higher totals, producing flash-flood potential in low-lying terminals and access roads.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; minor coastal erosion; brief power interruptions possible.
